sentences.english: The television viewer pays no tax or charges for receiving programs on his set.
sentences.chinese: 电视观众对于电视机的使用不必交付任何捐税或费用。

sentences.english: Taxation bears heavily on all classes in that country.
sentences.chinese: 捐税沉重地压在该国各阶层的人身上。

sentences.english: State business credits and other tax incentives are also available.
sentences.chinese: 州的商业信用和其他的捐税鼓励同样有效。

sentences.english: Local taxes were sometimes farmed out by the Governor.
sentences.chinese: 地方捐税有时由总督包给别人去征收。

sentences.english: They hope for a small diminution in taxes.
sentences.chinese: 他们希望捐税能稍有减少。

sentences.english: Before liberation, taxes weighed heavily upon the people.
sentences.chinese: 解放前，各种捐税沉重地压在人民身上。

sentences.english: In addition, no future tax benefit has been calculated.
sentences.chinese: 另外，也没有计算今后的捐税减免。

sentences.english: There were to be no tariffs or taxes on interstate commerce.
sentences.chinese: 对各州之间的贸易不得课取关税或捐税。

sentences.english: The working people in that country are burdened with heavy taxes.
sentences.chinese: 沉重的捐税压在那个国家劳动人民的身上。

sentences.english: Members of the service staff shall be exempt from dues and taxes on the wages which they receive for their services.
sentences.chinese: 服务人员就其服务所得之工资免纳捐税。

sentences.english: Some people live abroad to get out of paying heavy taxes.
sentences.chinese: 有些人居住在国外，为的是摆脱沉重的捐税负担。

definition: taxation/in former times, esp. land tax
a form of transit taxation in China introduced to finance armies to suppress the Taiping Rebellion
to tax by force and extort levies (idiom); to screw taxes out of the people by force
to apportion expenses, responsibilities etc/to demand contributions
